climbs.name: Welcome To Dove Creek
climbs.fa: FA: Tim Foulkes FFA: Luke Mehall

content.description:
A fun, funky little line.

Starts with a couple moves of off-width, protected by one or two #5 Camalots, then moves into fist/hand sized crack leading to a fun #2 Camalot roof finish.
content.location: Left of Just Lie It Back. A nice little belay area, marked by a plaque.

content.description:
The hardest route on the wall.

Some creative stemming with small gear leads up to the crux, a burly, but short section of overhanging finger jams.

After this its an enjoyable hand crack to a short off-width section that guards the anchor.
content.protection: (1) grey Metolius (1) purple Metolius (1) .2 (1) .3 (1) .4 (1) orange Metolius (1) .5 (1) .75 (1) #2 (1) #3 (1) #4 (1) #5
content.location: The leftmost route on the wall. A small trail with some cairns leads over from the High Country Elevator.

climbs.name: The Mustache Lady's Sister
climbs.fa: FA: Eric Dixon, FFA: Felix Parham

content.description:
The start of the route is marked by two protection bolts, that can be supplemented with gear. Climb past the bolts into a right facing dihedral.

There is also a more direct start on the other side of the flake. That was the original start, and the other more intuitive start with bolts was cleaned and added after the FA.
content.location: The first route you'll walk by in the main Dove Creek zone. Marked by a plaque.

climbs.name: Mustache Lady
climbs.fa: FA: Eric Dixon, FFA: Luke Mehall

content.description:
The splitter-est route on the wall!

A perfect dihedral from beginning to end.
A super sweet off-width dihedral. Very obvious route, the first line you'll come to at the crag after hiking over from Optimator.
content.protection:
(1) #4, (4) #5, (1) #6

An old #5 Camalot (the green one) could be useful as well.
content.location: A plaque marks the start of the route.

climbs.name: High Country Elevator
climbs.fa: FA: Eric Dixon/Tim Foulkes, FFA: Luke Mehall

content.description:
A varied and interesting line which requires some stamina and creativity.

Start up a flake and then stem up into the crux, protected by a bolt. Navigate the crux and begin a pumpfest into a short finger crack, followed by overhanging hands section, finishing by traversing a roof.

Be sure to use a 70 meter rope on this one!
content.protection:
(1) quickdraw

(1) purple Metolius (1) .2 (1) .3 (2-3) .4 (3) .5 (3-4) .75 (1) black Metolius or #2 Friend (4-5) #1s (3-4) #2s (3-4) #3s (1) #4
content.location: Just left of the Mustache Lady.

climbs.name: 99 Cent Tamale
climbs.fa: FA: Eric Dixon, FFA: Mike "The Mayor" Shaw

content.description: This Creek moderate can be climbed almost entirely using face holds.
